reviews.text: Build your own pizza!? I love this place! Getting to see your topping options makes it so much easier to try new things üôè 10/10

One of the dirtier restaurant experiences I‚Äôve had in a while.

Upon walking into the location, grateful for a warm greeting. Pretty much down hill from there.

First impressions was just dirty. Food all over floors. 7 employees behind the counter, 4 of which stood leaning against counters or ovens doing nothing, yet shocked to see empty lemonade dispensers, food all over the floor and filthy table tops.

First girl seemed to enjoy being at work, second girl treated us like it was a chore and pain to serve us.

Prices compared to other comparable build your own pizza places are high.

Child chairs were left in a variety of random places. Every one of them was gross.

Table and chairs were dirty and sticky. Again, with employees stood around, is there not time to address the dirty lobby?

Good choices to design your own pizza including a gluten-free option. Nice variety of fresh toppings and cheeses. A little on the expensive side for a pizza, but probably matches the quality of the product.

Slow Sunday service.   The crew of 3 behind the counter worked very slow, in fact too slow.  It was odd watching them move about so slow. There was only one person before us and yet it took nearly 40 minutes for us to get our order done.  I ordered the meat eater specialty pizza with spicy red sauce on a keto crust and it was really good.  The Greek side salad on the other hand was the most bland salad I've ever had in my life. The dressing had absolutely no flavor.  In fact, I was given a side container of olive oil which was not the Greek dressing I was expecting.  I was told that the server didn't shake the bottle before serving my dressing so I was given another but it was still just as bland and tasted of pure olive oil.  (I love olive oil just not like this) The salad had no seasoning, No salt no pepper no flavor whatsoever.  It had the essence of feta but not enough to add flavor, only one cherry tomato and a couple pieces of chopped olive which didn't help flavor at all.   My sister ordered the same salad and agreed it was flavorless.  Greek salad is my favorite but this was not it. I don't recommend the Greek salad.
Aside from the extremely slow service and terrible salad the pizza was good.  I will not return on a Sunday though.

Terrible pizza that I just threw away. The crust was so dark on the bottom that it tasted burnt. I looked under the pieces, and they all looked like the one I flipped over in the image. Just go somewhere else unless this kind of pizza is your jam. If you need some vegan options in the Lehi/AF area, then go to Mod Pizza or Via 313.

editorial_summary.overview: Hip counter-serve pizzeria dishing up crispy, thin-crust pies made with creative toppings & sauces.

recentReviews.text: The pizza was ok. There where a lot of people behind the counter. Only on person was cleaning up. That's pretty standard these days I guess. The no straws is what really seems ridiculous. I don't no if they where just out or it's a new company policy. When I asked the response was more of a statement. "No Straws". I didn't ask for an explanation. I won't go back to get one either I am getting tired of people in the customer service field that feel like we owe them something for showing up to a place of business. Maybe they aren't looking at the prices and doing the math. 5-30% is a lot and what do we get for it No Straws lol

I am simple so pretty much always just get a cheese with either the spicy red or just red sauce and it's always good. Just can't give 5 stars cause there is definitely better pizza but for a chain it's pretty good IMO.

I really like the pizza here, the only issue I have is the staff, they never greet you, they always look annoyed when you walk through the door, not even a smile, is sad cause sometimes I have to pass on going because of their attitude and it‚Äôs the closest location I can go
Don't come here if you use cash... They will turn you away. Who really doesn't accept the currency our economy is based off of? Unbelievable.
Their Pizza is always consistently good.

Good choices to design your own pizza including a gluten-free option. Nice variety of fresh toppings and cheeses. A little on the expensive side for a pizza, but probably matches the quality of the product.

I was a regular here until I placed an order online then headed to the store. The order was not ready and I was a little early, based on the eta on the app. I watched a large group or multiple groups getting served before me even though my order was placed in advance and they just walked in. Now I just go to Village Baker. My order was almost 30mins past eta.
They have really good wood fired pizza, and there aren‚Äôt a lot of wood fired pizza places around here.

Fun to customize your own pizza. The crust is a little thin for my taste. Of course you can get the thick one, but it cost more and it has way more calories but the biggest issue is they got rid of their keto option so it‚Äôs really hard to get enough protein with low enough calories here.

detailedReviews.author: Ryan Campbell
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was ok. There where a lot of people behind the counter. Only on person was cleaning up. That's pretty standard these days I guess. The no straws is what really seems ridiculous. I don't no if they where just out or it's a new company policy. When I asked the response was more of a statement. "No Straws". I didn't ask for an explanation. I won't go back to get one either I am getting tired of people in the customer service field that feel like we owe them something for showing up to a place of business. Maybe they aren't looking at the prices and doing the math. 5-30% is a lot and what do we get for it No Straws lol

detailedReviews.author: Zach Opie (Opie)
detailedReviews.text: I am simple so pretty much always just get a cheese with either the spicy red or just red sauce and it's always good. Just can't give 5 stars cause there is definitely better pizza but for a chain it's pretty good IMO.

detailedReviews.author: Karu Uranga
detailedReviews.text: I really like the pizza here, the only issue I have is the staff, they never greet you, they always look annoyed when you walk through the door, not even a smile, is sad cause sometimes I have to pass on going because of their attitude and it‚Äôs the closest location I can go

detailedReviews.author: Chared Falunski
detailedReviews.text: Don't come here if you use cash... They will turn you away. Who really doesn't accept the currency our economy is based off of? Unbelievable.

detailedReviews.author: Terra Development
detailedReviews.text: Their Pizza is always consistently good.

detailedReviews.author: Steve Turley
detailedReviews.text: Good choices to design your own pizza including a gluten-free option. Nice variety of fresh toppings and cheeses. A little on the expensive side for a pizza, but probably matches the quality of the product.

detailedReviews.author: Chuck Baird
detailedReviews.text: I was a regular here until I placed an order online then headed to the store. The order was not ready and I was a little early, based on the eta on the app. I watched a large group or multiple groups getting served before me even though my order was placed in advance and they just walked in. Now I just go to Village Baker. My order was almost 30mins past eta.

detailedReviews.author: Harrison Scarbrough
detailedReviews.text: They have really good wood fired pizza, and there aren‚Äôt a lot of wood fired pizza places around here.

detailedReviews.author: Joshua Dance
detailedReviews.text: Fun to customize your own pizza. The crust is a little thin for my taste. Of course you can get the thick one, but it cost more and it has way more calories but the biggest issue is they got rid of their keto option so it‚Äôs really hard to get enough protein with low enough calories here.

detailedReviews.author: Levander Davis
detailedReviews.text: Great experience as always.

detailedReviews.author: Nicole Hill
detailedReviews.text: Oh it was so good and fresh, I loved that we could choose what we got on it

detailedReviews.author: Kristopher Lyman
detailedReviews.text: Great variety!

detailedReviews.author: Nina Klopfenstine
detailedReviews.text: Build your own pizza!? I love this place! Getting to see your topping options makes it so much easier to try new things üôè 10/10

detailedReviews.author: Andrea Johnson
detailedReviews.text: The workers for the time we went were very nice! They got us the exact pizzas we wanted for lunch. Everything was handled well with care and with good hygiene as well.

detailedReviews.author: MrsG MrsR
detailedReviews.text: The usual Blaze Pizza fare. Made exactly as ordered. We were definitely standing out, the other guests were making sure of that.

detailedReviews.author: Eric Hall
detailedReviews.text: Food and staff are great. The only compliment I have is they don't have calzones.

detailedReviews.author: Derek Andrews
detailedReviews.text: Great experience recently. It‚Äôs always nice, but the staff and overall experience was excellent on our last visit.

detailedReviews.author: Stuart Roskelley
detailedReviews.text: They covered our order of 12 pizzas really well without any issue. Everything tasted great!

detailedReviews.author: Nathan Walker
detailedReviews.text:
Painfully slow service. You can get quicker pizza from a place like Domino's.
Edit: They gave me a free brownie because my order was so late, which is nice so I added a star, but I still wish I didn't have to wait as long as I did.

detailedReviews.author: LilCoach Will
detailedReviews.text: I live in South Jordan and prefer to drive to this location over the Taylorsville location. Very fast service and clean dining area.

detailedReviews.author: Mike H
detailedReviews.text: Terrible pizza that I just threw away. The crust was so dark on the bottom that it tasted burnt. I looked under the pieces, and they all looked like the one I flipped over in the image. Just go somewhere else unless this kind of pizza is your jam. If you need some vegan options in the Lehi/AF area, then go to Mod Pizza or Via 313.

detailedReviews.author: Jim Bolinder
detailedReviews.text: Quick lunch made to order. Love the make your own with variety of base and toppings.

detailedReviews.author: Ian Jack
detailedReviews.text: I love that I can get a vegan pizza here.

detailedReviews.author: Castillo Verito27
detailedReviews.text: Really good pizza, employees were very friendly üëåüèª

detailedReviews.author: Pedro Jimenez
detailedReviews.text: Executive

detailedReviews.author: Mike Foss
detailedReviews.text: This place is great for a good bite to eat.

detailedReviews.author: Ethan Herrington
detailedReviews.text: Kat's just the best and the staff is helpful

detailedReviews.author: Jacque
detailedReviews.text: We ordered 3 pizzas, salad and breadsticks for $35. Tons of topping and options to choose from. We ordered take out and it was hot and ready to go. Would definitely recommend. Lots of vegetarian options üå±

detailedReviews.author: Josh Carroll
detailedReviews.text: Hands down the best Blaze location I've been to... Occasionally, they ignore the additional instructions box for online orders, but even then it's just too damn good!

detailedReviews.author: David McCully
detailedReviews.text: This is just like a mod pizza, except there's no flavor and only one size.

detailedReviews.author: Emma Pennington
detailedReviews.text:
Last night, I accidentally left a bad review for this place but here‚Äôs the real story‚Ä¶. I went to a restaurant for my moms birthday but they sat us and never came back! So we stayed there for 20 minutes and then left and came to Blaze. Let me tell you that every single time I come to blaze it SLAPS. Could not recommend more. LeBron is not the GOAT in my opinion but he does have the GPOAT (greatest pizza of all time)

Sorry for the accidental bad review! It is now posted on the correct restaurant!

detailedReviews.author: Brady Harper
detailedReviews.text: It's a pretty good place to get a pretty good pizza

detailedReviews.author: Larry Paxton
detailedReviews.text: It's about the only pizza place near Thanksgiving Point - I'm glad for that. Only took about 10 minutes to bake the pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Luci Mae Heward
detailedReviews.text: this was an AWESOME SAUCE experience. Kat and Dakota were absolute goats and had excellent customer service. Helped with our order and packaged everything up nice. The atmosphere is very friendly and welcoming and the food was a 10/10

detailedReviews.author: Rubymay Taylor
detailedReviews.text: The vibe was AMAZING here, super friendly staff that seemed happy to be there and totally awesome. Felt very welcome and wanted to be here, not to even mention that the food is an absolute 23/10! Special shoutout to Dakota and Kat for being awesome and super helpful when taking our order and packing it up for us. Efficient and wonderful!

detailedReviews.author: Leslie Hefner
detailedReviews.text: This was not my first visit to a Blaze Pizza but they never fail to be great. This time I got really adventurous in my choices of toppings and not only does that make it more fun but even more delicious. Blaze Pizza is a great place for family and friends.

detailedReviews.author: Esidro Martinez
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôm not sure how to rate this, I come here a lot on my break from work. I love the food, service has always been great, but this past Monday I found glass in my pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Wayne Hamilton
detailedReviews.text: Let the ability to customize any of the pizzas. It's a winner for the whole family usually

detailedReviews.author: Kyle Willett
detailedReviews.text: Good food

detailedReviews.author: Charli Garrett
detailedReviews.text: Great food, great service. Mitchell was especially helpful

detailedReviews.author: Christopher Scott
detailedReviews.text: [THERE WAS A RODANT] When we walked in there was not a clean table in the restaurant, food and garbage under every last table. I complained about it as we were ordering, the girl sent one of the workers out to clean, and he did such a half ass job, I went back up and told the same girl that she should come out and see what I was seeing that it was absolutely disgusting. She dismissed me saying yeah we were busy, and she never came out to look at what I was complaining about. Towards the end of my meal at approximately 8:47pm I went back up and ordered a drink, the real manager took that order and tried to hand me a gift certificate, I politely declined and expressed my concern about the the girl's lack of concern for cleanliness, as I was making this complaint, and I cannot make this up, I see a RODANT, BE IT A MOUSE, RAT, OR WHAT HAVE YOU, RUN OUT FROM UNDER THE LEFT SIDE OF THE PIZZA OVEN, AND RUN BACK UNDER IT, WHEN I GO TO SEE WHERE IT RAN TO I SEE A GIANT RODANT TRAP, SO THEY ARE AWARE OF THE PROBLEM. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING. I WILL NEVER, GO BACK TO ANOTHER BLAZE PIZZA. They don't value their customers, and they don't value cleanliness.

detailedReviews.author: Andrew Graft
detailedReviews.text: Here for lunch‚Ä¶ Only person in the restaurant‚Ä¶ When I mentioned the icemaker doesn‚Äôt work the young man behind the counter says ‚Äúyeah it‚Äôs been weird lately. ‚Äú I say, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs OK. But if there isn‚Äôt any ice, I‚Äôll just not have the drink drink and get my money back. ‚Äú He goes back to the fire pit oven and 10 minutes later when I ask him about the ice, he says ‚Äúyeah it‚Äôs been weird lately. ‚Äú Very odd service. Maybe it‚Äôs just the day and this particular staff. Food is pretty good though. Maybe a pick up order is the way to go.

detailedReviews.author: serena s
detailedReviews.text: First of all disgusting! An employee resting and sitting his bottom on the pizza work station! I walked right out after I seen how unsanitary that was. Secondly there are about 6 employees, only 1 actually working (very slowly). This is actually insane because I drove pretty far to get there and I love blaze pizza. There was no need of urgency for the 6 people in line they just stood around and took no ones orders.

detailedReviews.author: Jordyn Tanner
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely delicious

detailedReviews.author: Kyle Rutledge
detailedReviews.text: Pizza is awesome here, but the staff was a little stand-off-ish. No ‚Äúhi‚Äù or greetings, or ‚Äúhere you go‚Äù or ‚Äúenjoy‚Äù when the food was ready. I thought it was just the first guy but both guys I interacted with were the same way. They did a great job on the pizza though.

detailedReviews.author: Jasmine Kelly
detailedReviews.text:
Constantly fails us, CONSTANTLY.

Sometimes you hit a gold mine and it‚Äôs the best pizza ever, most of the time it is actually disgustingly burnt or soggy or just not even your order.

Besides this, the employees are the same way as their pizza: the best or disgustingly soggy

Your experience will either be calm and easy or it will be the equivalent of purgatory

The short man with brown hair and unkept scruff and neck beard is awful at customer service AND using the oven and following instructions..which is what is needed for his entire job. He is lazy. We once stood at the register for 5 minutes after being told to wait for him to finish his task (labeling pizza papers for 3 pizzas) this for some reason took a long time and we kinda just‚Ä¶stood there. he didn‚Äôt make the pizzas he had just labeled until we had almost left, so I don‚Äôt really understand why we stood there.

My gf works across the street and her work orders all the time, it‚Äôs a shame they do this so frequently. This is a recent pizza from today.

detailedReviews.author: Amber Roberts
detailedReviews.text: Very slow and awkward service. We like Blaze pizza but not enough to keep coming back due to the poor service.

detailedReviews.author: Jared Hicken
detailedReviews.text: They now take your order at the counter and no longer allow you to pick toppings as you go. Very disappointing.

detailedReviews.author: Kris Keeffer
detailedReviews.text: You can never go wrong with blaze pizza, hot fast and customizable!

detailedReviews.author: Dallas Silcox
detailedReviews.text: We just received our order and 1 of the pizzas didn't even have cheese on it. I get you pick your toppings but cheese should be an automatic base on any pizza then you select your toppings.  For the price then to not even get cheese on there I won't be ordering from there again

detailedReviews.author: Val M
detailedReviews.text:
Based around a single 10" size, about right for 1 or 2 (not sure if a special size is available) on a a Very thin crust, there are a few standard pizzas, that are OK, but seem to limited enough to want you to order a more expensive 2-topping choice. The taste was good but not outstanding, partly because of the card stock crust.  Drinks expensive, cheese bread garlicky. The room was upscale with a row of close tables for a group and a row of square tables.  As typical,  the ambiance was loud!  Reverberating.
For the service of robotic taking the order and calling out a name (that could not be heard).  they also suggested a tip starting at 15, to 30%. For not being able to answer a basic order question,  0 seemed appropriate.

detailedReviews.author: NA Reayfam
detailedReviews.text: This was my first time at Blaze. I don't like pizza very much, so I was surprised to find that I loved my pizza here. I will definitely return. I recommend the build your own, and include the garlic pesto sauce and ricotta. The lemonades are also great!

detailedReviews.author: E west
detailedReviews.text:
One of the dirtier restaurant experiences I‚Äôve had in a while.

Upon walking into the location, grateful for a warm greeting. Pretty much down hill from there.

First impressions was just dirty. Food all over floors. 7 employees behind the counter, 4 of which stood leaning against counters or ovens doing nothing, yet shocked to see empty lemonade dispensers, food all over the floor and filthy table tops.

First girl seemed to enjoy being at work, second girl treated us like it was a chore and pain to serve us.

Prices compared to other comparable build your own pizza places are high.

Child chairs were left in a variety of random places. Every one of them was gross.

Table and chairs were dirty and sticky. Again, with employees stood around, is there not time to address the dirty lobby?

detailedReviews.author: Andrea Millward
detailedReviews.text: The pizza itself is always so good. I tried the meatballs last time and was not a fan. Too much breading, not enough meat. Brick oven and pizza dough really make those pizzas though. Paid around $12 for a personal pizza that I shared with my 9yo.

detailedReviews.author: James Lincoln
detailedReviews.text: Terrible experience at Blaze. It took 45 minutes to get our pizza and there were 6 people in line ahead of us. Either understaffed or just slow moving but it was awful.

detailedReviews.author: Podatix
detailedReviews.text: One of the best places I‚Äôve tried, the crew are very friendly and attentive. Real pizza experts.

detailedReviews.author: Gary L
detailedReviews.text: This place is so unorganized. I gave it a go after about 6 months and it‚Äôs even worse now.

detailedReviews.author: Bryant Clayton
detailedReviews.text: I'd never been here before, so I asked Noah to make me his personal go-to. I'm disappointed that I didn't take notice to whatever he did. All I know is that it's the same pizza he makes for himself at the end of every shift for the last seven months. If a genie just so happened to grant me one wish to have any food I wanted while stranded on a desert island, I'd choose Noah's pizza. It's delicious, savory, and I know that I could at least go 7 months without getting sick of it.

detailedReviews.author: Brian Heiner
detailedReviews.text:
I never write reviews but this experience really left a bad taste in my mouth. I walked in to an empty restaurant to be scowled at by the girl behind the counter. Without any kind of greeting she flatly asks what I wanted to order. After I ordered and told her it was to go, I sat and waited for my pizza. When they called my name, it was on a platter to dine in. I asked politely for it to go and the guy acted like I was putting him out. He put the pizza in a box and whipped it onto the counter without a word.

I get it, it‚Äôs a pizza place. I‚Äôm not expecting Michelin service but damn. I‚Äôve been treated better at dive bars. I used to go here semi regularly but after this miserable display, I won‚Äôt be back.

detailedReviews.author: ray porter
detailedReviews.text: Never again. Sub average pizza and totally inefficient.

detailedReviews.author: Eddie Tooley
detailedReviews.text:
There have been many changes lately to the menu. The employees are friendly but for the lunch rush there were not enough.

When Blaze opened they had 8 exciting pizzas, think California Pizza Kitchen, with the option to split between two and still make changes for no additional charge.

Next you could do the same but got charged extra for a custom pizza.

Today they have 6 lame pizza offerings, think Pizza Hut, or build your own.

I'm not going back unless someone insists. There are too many good options to waste time and money at a place that has fallen so far. They do have cool drink lids.

detailedReviews.author: Lacie Jackson
detailedReviews.text: First time here and I wasn't super impressed. Not sure of it was a bad cook, but the pizza was burned pretty badly. We got cheese bread and it had zero flavor. I see there are good reviews so maybe just a bad day for them? The front end employee was friendly.

detailedReviews.author: Alex Stringfellow
detailedReviews.text: This place is super fun, but tonight we got a large pizza to-go and got home to a super black, charred crust. Almost too burnt to eat. I‚Äôm sure it would‚Äôve been a great pizza besides that. Unfortunate! For sure not worth the $23 we spent or the 20+ minute wait

detailedReviews.author: Steven Perry
detailedReviews.text: Great food!

detailedReviews.author: Aaron Williams
detailedReviews.text: Great food! great price!

detailedReviews.author: Kelsey Turcotte
detailedReviews.text: Now that they fixed the BYO ordering process I love them again.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customer opinions are divided. The 4.0/5 rating from 100 recent reviews suggests some great experiences mixed with areas needing attention.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the ability to customize their own pizza with a wide variety of fresh toppings and cheeses, including gluten-free and vegan options. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The consistently good quality of pizza, especially the unique wood-fired option, is a standout feature appreciated by customers. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
Fast service and a clean dining area make this location a preferred choice for a quick lunch. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Negative staff attitude and poor customer service - review management can address this concern
Long wait times and order inaccuracies - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Cleanliness and hygiene concerns, including rodent sightings - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: Zach Opie (Opie)
positive.text: I am simple so pretty much always just get a cheese with either the spicy red or just red sauce and it's always good. Just can't give 5 stars cause there is definitely better pizza but for a chain it's pretty good IMO.

positive.author: Terra Development
positive.text: Their Pizza is always consistently good.

positive.author: Steve Turley
positive.text: Good choices to design your own pizza including a gluten-free option. Nice variety of fresh toppings and cheeses. A little on the expensive side for a pizza, but probably matches the quality of the product.

neutral.author: Karu Uranga
neutral.text: I really like the pizza here, the only issue I have is the staff, they never greet you, they always look annoyed when you walk through the door, not even a smile, is sad cause sometimes I have to pass on going because of their attitude and it‚Äôs the closest location I can go

neutral.author: Nathan Walker
neutral.text:
Painfully slow service. You can get quicker pizza from a place like Domino's.
Edit: They gave me a free brownie because my order was so late, which is nice so I added a star, but I still wish I didn't have to wait as long as I did.

negative.author: Ryan Campbell
negative.text: The pizza was ok. There where a lot of people behind the counter. Only on person was cleaning up. That's pretty standard these days I guess. The no straws is what really seems ridiculous. I don't no if they where just out or it's a new company policy. When I asked the response was more of a statement. "No Straws". I didn't ask for an explanation. I won't go back to get one either I am getting tired of people in the customer service field that feel like we owe them something for showing up to a place of business. Maybe they aren't looking at the prices and doing the math. 5-30% is a lot and what do we get for it No Straws lol

negative.author: Chared Falunski
negative.text: Don't come here if you use cash... They will turn you away. Who really doesn't accept the currency our economy is based off of? Unbelievable.

negative.author: Chuck Baird
negative.text: I was a regular here until I placed an order online then headed to the store. The order was not ready and I was a little early, based on the eta on the app. I watched a large group or multiple groups getting served before me even though my order was placed in advance and they just walked in. Now I just go to Village Baker. My order was almost 30mins past eta.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
